frame.name: Experiencer_focus
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe an <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s emotions with respect to some <fen>Content</fen>. A <fen>Reason</fen> for the emotion may also be expressed. Although the <fen>Content</fen> may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.
<ex> <fex name="Experiencer">My</fex> <t>enjoyment</t> <fex name="Content">of the movie</fex> was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me. </ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Smithers</fex> <m>takes</m> <fex name="Degree">great</fex> <t>pleasure</t> <fex name="Content">in collecting matchboxes</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Sergio</fex> <m>derives</m> <fex name="Degree">great</fex> <t>pleasure</t> <fex name="Content">from smoking</fex>.</ex> <ex> Smoking <ment>gives</ment> <fex name="Experiencer">me</fex> <fex name="Degree">extreme</fex> <t>pleasure</t>.</ex> With certain verbs, the <fen>Circumstances</fen> can be expressed in a finite clausal or wh- complement which may optionally be preceded by a Null NP Object: <ex><fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> <t>hate</t> it <fex name="Circumstances">when you do that</fex>.</ex> Note: This is not how it is currently tagged. </def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon. The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Everyone</fex> <t>loves</t> <fex name="Content">compliments</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Everyone</fex> <t>loves</t> <fex name="Content">being complimented</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">His parents</fex> <t>despaired</t> <fex name="Content">of him</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">John</fex> <t>likes</t> <fex name="Content">that I cook him lunch</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> am <t>afraid</t> <fex name="Content">of spiders</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why an <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the particular emotion. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">People</fex> <t>love</t> <fex name="Content">giant pandas</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because they look like teddy bears</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
<ex> The <t>delight</t> <fex name="Expressor">on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment. </ex> <ex> The worshipper's <t>apprehensive</t> <fex name="Expressor">praise</fex> revealed his lacking devotion. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex>Very few physical science students stressed the <fex name="Parameter">intellectual</fex> <t>enjoyment</t> of the degree course. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Mr. Whiskers</fex> was <t>upset</t> <fex name="Topic">about his cat treats</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Experiencer">Tracy</fex> was in an <t>irritated</t> <fex name="State">mood</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. <ex> It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a <t>nervous</t> <fex name="Event">ceremony</fex>.</ex> Here we know that the ceremony was filled with nervous <fen>Experiencer</fen>s.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> FE encodes the circumstances or conditions under which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion. Unlike <fen>Content</fen> it does not give the specific content of the emotion, but the <fen>Content</fen> can often be inferred from the <fen>Circumstances</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
<ex><fex name="tim">Last year</fex>, Bob was still <t>interested</t> in the young Republicans.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: abhor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: detest; hate.

lexUnit.name: abominate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: detest.

lexUnit.name: adore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: love and respect deeply.

lexUnit.name: delight.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take great pleasure in.

lexUnit.name: despair.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: lose or be without hope

lexUnit.name: despise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel contempt or repugnance for.

lexUnit.name: detest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: dislike intensely.

lexUnit.name: dislike.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel distaste for or hostility towards.

lexUnit.name: dread.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: anticipate with great apprehension or fear.

lexUnit.name: empathize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: understand and share the feelings of another

lexUnit.name: enjoy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take pleasure in

lexUnit.name: envy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel envy of

lexUnit.name: fear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be afraid of; feel anxiety on behalf of

lexUnit.name: grieve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: suffer grief

lexUnit.name: hate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel intense dislike for or a strong aversion towards

lexUnit.name: like.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: find agreeable, enjoyable, or satisfactory

lexUnit.name: loathe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel hatred or disgust for.

lexUnit.name: love.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: like very much.

lexUnit.name: mourn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel deep sorrow following the death or loss of.

lexUnit.name: pity.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel pity for.

lexUnit.name: regret.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel or express sorrow, repentance, or disappointment over.

lexUnit.name: relish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: take great pleasure in

lexUnit.name: resent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel bitterness or indignation at.

lexUnit.name: rue.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to feel compassion for; pity

lexUnit.name: rueful.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: expressing regret, especially in a wry or humorous way.

lexUnit.name: hatred.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: intense dislike.

lexUnit.name: empathy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the ability to empathize.

lexUnit.name: empathetic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing empathy

lexUnit.name: compassion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others.

lexUnit.name: savour.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. appreciate and enjoy the taste of (good food or drink)or enjoy or appreciate to the full.

lexUnit.name: luxuriate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: no obj. luxuriate in/over enjoy as a luxury.

lexUnit.name: afraid.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: fearful or anxious.

lexUnit.name: terrified.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: extremely fearful

lexUnit.name: scared.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: afraid

lexUnit.name: dread.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: great fear or apprehension

lexUnit.name: dislike.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of aversion or distaste.

lexUnit.name: enjoyment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of enjoying something

lexUnit.name: desperation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a state of despair, especially as resulting in rash or extreme behaviour

lexUnit.name: envy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: discontented or resentful longing aroused by another's possessions, qualities, or luck

lexUnit.name: loathing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of extreme disgust

lexUnit.name: pity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the feeling of sorrow and compassion caused by the sufferings of others

lexUnit.name: regret.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling of sorrow, repentance, or disappointment

lexUnit.name: resentment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: bitterness; indignation.

lexUnit.name: adoration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of adoring; profound love

lexUnit.name: abhorrence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or feeling of abhorring

lexUnit.name: relish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: great enjoyment

lexUnit.name: detestation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: intense dislike

lexUnit.name: nettled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be annoyed

lexUnit.name: worried.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling trouble over difficulties

lexUnit.name: nervous.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: easily agitated

lexUnit.name: apprehensive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: anticipating with anxiety or fear.

lexUnit.name: fond.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having an affection or liking for.

lexUnit.name: interested.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: wanting to know

lexUnit.name: agape.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: in a state of amazement , as with the mouth wide open.

lexUnit.name: fulfilled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: satisfied.

lexUnit.name: fulfillment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: satisfaction.

lexUnit.name: satisfaction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of having one's desires sated.

lexUnit.name: satisfied.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: content.

lexUnit.name: worked up.a

lexUnit.name: dissatisfied.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not content

lexUnit.name: fazed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: caused to show discomposure

lexUnit.name: unfazed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not disturbed

lexUnit.name: calm.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: peaceful and undisturbed

lexUnit.name: comfort.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: consolation for grief or anxiety

lexUnit.name: solace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: comfort or consolation in time of distress.

lexUnit.name: pleasure.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling of happy satisfaction and enjoyment.

lexUnit.name: irritated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: annoyed or angry

lexUnit.name: upset.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being unhappy about something

lexUnit.name: antipathy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep-seated feeling of aversion

lexUnit.name: taken.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: be attracted or charmed by.

lexUnit.name: fed up.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having lost patience

lexUnit.name: intimidated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: frightened.

lexUnit.name: feverish.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: nervous, excited.

lexUnit.name: feverishly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: in an nervously excided manner.

lexUnit.name: cool.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: calm and collected

lexUnit.name: easy.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state in which the experiencer is at ease; free from worry or anxiety.

lexUnit.name: discomfort.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of mental distress
